name: State_9

timeline_beats.label: Major naval engagement in the Great Naval War

factions.label: Shipwright Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls docks, ship construction and trade tariffs; dominant in coastal towns

factions.label: Harbor Lord Council
factions.influence_hint: Hereditary maritime aristocracy; coordinates defense and diplomacy

factions.label: Salt & Fish Consortium
factions.influence_hint: Controls preservation works and export networks; merchant wealth

factions.label: Tide-College (augury cultists)
factions.influence_hint: Regulates navigational auguries and ritual reagents; technical-religious authority

factions.label: Coastal Home Guard
factions.influence_hint: Local militia; rising influence after pirate-era mobilizations

traits: ritual respect for seasonal winds and shoals

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned; state rituals must not enable it
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents and specialized guild labor
notes: Strategic chokepoint: Twin Narrows at Harbor City entrance
Seasonal monsoon/wind windows govern major sail convoys
Key imported reagents (brine-amber, star-salt) controlled by Tide-College and merchant houses
Shipwright Guild holds near-monopoly on large-hull construction; guild licenses shape politics
Naval obligations to Coastal Defense Compact affect fleet allocations and taxes
